Cooks Sandals

Hand crafted eco-sponsible footwear

Carefree comfort

Cooks sandals are made in America using salvaged materials and American made products. The process begins with salvaged polypropylene sacks, which are washed, cut, and sewn into strips. Paired to strength-tested nylon and soft denim, these plastic strips create a light and durable strap which does not retain moisture or stretch. These straps are plumbed into a foot bed made from recycled tire and sustainably harvested cork.

Durable and eco-friendly

Hand made in Travelers Rest, South Carolina, each pair of cooks is distinctly its own. No two pairs are the same. Through unique styling and design cooks is driven to influence current style by pairing quality materials with salvaged goods to create extremely functional products that will last a lifetime. Stand for something, with a pair of flip flops constructed from new and salvaged materials. Designed to last, built to be comfortable.

Crafted in America

Cooks sandals are made in America using salvaged materials and American made products. The process begins with salvaged polypropylene sacks, which are washed, cut, and sewn into strips. Paired to strength-tested nylon and soft denim, these plastic strips create a light and durable strap which does not retain moisture or stretch. These straps are plumbed into a foot bed made from recycled tire and sustainably harvested cork.

Surprisingly comfortable
